page.title: 12THE PRINCE REGENT
page.content: Brighton's existence as a tourist resort owes much to the Prince Regent. In the summer of 1783 he first visited the town.He was a tall, elegant and courteous twenty-one year old, who was later to become King George IV. He enjoyed the theatre, horse-racing and attending dinner-parties in the town, where he met a local aristocrat by the name of Lady Maria Fitzherbert. In 1785 the prince secretly married this virtuous Catholic girl, six years older than himself and already twice previously married.Earlier laws prevented mixed religous marriages for royalty and under the Royal Marriage Act he was not allowed to marry without his father's consent before he was 25 years of age.
